p: The antimicrobial activities of cinnamon oil and AgNPs were assessed against the planktonic MDR S. agalactiae isolates. The agar well diffusion assay was applied as described elsewhere [ 51], and the isolates with inhibition zones` diameters ≥8 mm were considered susceptible [ 52]. Minimum inhibitory concentrations (MIC) and MBC of the tested antimicrobial agents were determined using the broth microdilution technique [ 53]. Moreover, the MIC50 and MIC90 were calculated using an orderly array method [ 54]. The interactions of the antimicrobial combinations were analyzed by a checkerboard assay [ 55]. The combination is considered synergistic when the ΣFIC is ≤0.5, indifferent when the ΣFIC is > 0.5 to < 2, and antagonistic when the ΣFIC is ≥2 [ 56].
